meanings.definition: The act of denying any responsibility or support for something.
meanings.sent1: Her disavowal of the stolen cookies left her friends puzzled.
meanings.sent2: The politician's disavowal of the controversial policy angered many voters.
meanings.sent3: The cat's disavowal of knocking over the vase was met with raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: His disavowal of his past mistakes was like trying to erase ink from paper.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's disavowal of grading the test fairly was evident to all the students.

meanings.definition: A statement that denies any connection or association with something.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity's disavowal of the scandalous rumors only fueled more gossip.
meanings.sent2: His disavowal of the criminal organization was met with skepticism by the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The dog's disavowal of chewing up the shoes was hard to believe.
meanings.sent4: Her disavowal of the toxic relationship was a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The company's disavowal of the faulty product was a blow to their reputation.
